text:
The path you are specifying in your <jsp-file> element is not valid.  You are
required to specify a context-relative path that begins with a "/" character. 
You should see error messages related to this in the Tomcat log files.

Please change your path to "/starter.jsp" and reopen this bug report if you are
still having problems.

remm@apache.org
text:
I didn't try to reproduce the bug, but the JSP cannot override init(), so what's
the point of making it load-on-startup ?
If you want to preload things, or implement init() and destroy() as a mean to
control your webapp's lifecycle, you should really be using a servlet.

The point is that, Jsp can override jspInit() method, like servlet can override 
init() method.
It works in Tomcat 3.2.x version.
